medical_history.chief_complaint: Persistent right lower quadrant/suprapubic pain and increased urinary frequency.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 2 days ago, characterized by dull and non-radiating pain. The patient also reports anorexia and associated nausea but denies fever, chills, shortness of breath, chest pain, vomiting, or changes in bowel function.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Childhood asthma, now with exercise-induced asthma, spontaneous left pneumothorax treated with Heimlich valve for 3 days, left shoulder arthroscopic repair of labrum.
